channel.title: My download speed has dropped
channel.description: My download speed has dropped from ~450 kbps to now 60kbps. I had a virus, but I fixed it by ending the process in Task Manager and then scanning AVG 9.0 free edition and getting rid of it. Then I restored my pc 3 days back. I was downloading a game and I realized i was downloading at 60kbps. To make sure it wasn't just the game or something i went to speedtest and this is what I got. [URL=http://www.speedtest.net][IMG]http://www.speedtest.net/result/905628821.png[/img][/URL] I have updated my network drivers and that didn't solve the problem. I also ran disk cleanup and disk defrag and it still didn't help. I was wondering if anyone on here could help me. Thanks. :( (I am using a Windows Vista Home Premium)

item.title: My download speed has dropped
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

the wanderer:

other computers on internet don’t get a slow download speed, so I’m going to bitch to my isp…

do you mean other computers on your network? if so, what does your isp have to do with it…

Read full topic

item.title: My download speed has dropped
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Sorry for not posting. I almost totally forgot I posted here. Football… totally drove it out of my mind. I checked internet and it seems fine, going to switch ports I plug ethernet cord in and other computers on internet don’t get a slow download speed, so I’m going to bitch to my isp…

Off-Topic: Woah, freaky that me and moparisthebest live within 100 miles of each other

Read full topic

item.title: My download speed has dropped
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:17, topic:353295”][quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=449612.msg3304619#msg3304619 date=1281567993]

[quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=449612.msg3304117#msg3304117 date=1281542550]

No problems here, but I still wish I had better upload. Fucking Charter their max upload is only 5Mbps

[/quote]must suck for you

you think you have it bad - when i was growing up there were 150 of us living in a shoe box in the middle of the road
[/quote]What BT Package are you using? Upgrade to 3 if you guys don’t have fibre down there, I’m still waiting for them to add fibre to London…

Option 3, but I’ve always had shit speeds. Someone who lives near me has the same package and gets similar speeds to me, so I guess my area just sucks. It’s free for me anyway, or I’d definitely have switched ISP’s by now.[/quote]Lool free, ofcourse some areas just suck

item.title: My download speed has dropped
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:1, topic:353295”]My download speed has dropped from ~450 kbps to now 60kbps. I had a virus, but I fixed it by ending the process in Task Manager and then scanning AVG 9.0 free edition and getting rid of it. Then I restored my pc 3 days back. I was downloading a game and I realized i was downloading at 60kbps. To make sure it wasn’t just the game or something i went to speedtest and this is what I got.
http://www.speedtest.net/result/905628821.png
I have updated my network drivers and that didn’t solve the problem. I also ran disk cleanup and disk defrag and it still didn’t help. I was wondering if anyone on here could help me. Thanks. (I am using a Windows Vista Home Premium)[/quote]

while a virus wouldn’t cause it, perhaps your nic is broken/faulty. if it has 2 separate interfaces (ethernet ports), try using the otherone and run a speed test. one of the ports on my nic broke somehow and was unable to operate at the intended speed, however the other port was just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: My download speed has dropped
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

xx matty xx:

you think you have it bad - when i was growing up there were 150 of us living in a shoe box in the middle of the road

Right. I had to get up in the morning at ten o’clock at night half an hour before I went to bed, drink a cup of sulphuric acid, work twenty-nine hours a day down mill, and pay mill owner for permission to come to work, and when we got home, our Dad and our mother would kill us and dance about on our graves singing Hallelujah.

This isn’t a post how fast your net is thread, so fuck off unless it has some relevance.

Read full topic

item.title: My download speed has dropped
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Seems we live very close to each other, less than 50 miles from Cincinnati:

Anyway, as Mopman said, try another computer and try bypassing any routers and hooking straight into the modem.

Read full topic

item.title: My download speed has dropped
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Is that DSL? A change in conditions on RADSL, for example a loose connection on an extension cable, can send their profiling stuff haywire - we got limited to like dialup speed once because someone doing work in the exchange managed to fuck up our connection while doing something else.

Try another machine on the network, and if possible another machine through a usb dsl modem straight into the master socket. If you’re still slow, check whether you’re actually synching slow (the speed reported by the modem/router as the “connection speed”) or synching fast but getting bad download. If you’re synching slow, bitch to your ISP.

EDIT: This is assuming you’re not just capped for usage as mentioned above ofc

Read full topic

item.title: My download speed has dropped
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:6, topic:353295”][quote author=goatee link=topic=449612.msg3298528#msg3298528 date=1281116541]
0.66mbps is 660 kbps? Or am i missing something?
[/quote]
you’re missing something.

why would you restore back 3 days AFTER removing malware?

you could always try TCP optimizer: http://www.speedguide.net/downloads.php[/quote]Also be sure that nothing changed your registry settings.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:

why would you restore back 3 days AFTER removing malware?

you could always try TCP optimizer: http://www.speedguide.net/downloads.php[/quote]
I restored because I knew the virus was recent because I had just ran a virus scan earlier that day. I downloaded TCP optimizer, but I’m not sure exactly what to do. :o I tried restoring windows default, but either it didn’t go to default or it didn’t work.

Bowser jr:

Check if you ISP have capped you because of high usage.

I’ll do that tomorrow probably because I have football in 45mins and won’t be back until late

Here is what it used to be. This is my results about 15 days ago.

Read full topic
